Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Cooperpete
Reviews.Content: My wife and two kids stayed in one of the two bedroom upstairs units for a week during our recent trip to San Diego. It was really nice having separate bedrooms, living room and a Kitchen. The rooms are very nice, clean and the area is safe; there are a lot of large beautiful homes in the area, which is for the most part residential. We have been to San Diego numerous times on vacation and have stayed in a different location every time. We will be back to this Hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Great View”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: My wife and our three children stayed here for two days. The views are amazing and we could hear the waves crashing right outside our window while we slept (rm 212). The room was very nice and clean. It was helpful to have two bedrooms. The hotel is very well kept with nice landscaping and heated pool. We really enjoyed the old school charm this place offered. If your looking for a beach location this isnt for you, its right on the cliffs but for us this was perfect....the views were incredible. The staff was very friendly and we had everthing we needed to have a pleasent stay. If you like the retro style older hotels this place is cool!!.... well maintained and clean. Would definitely recommend and will stay again next time in San Diego!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, great stay”
Reviews.Author: jcmadrid
Reviews.Content: We´re still here, but with the FREE WiFi in all the rooms, why wait till we´re gone to say how much we like it? :-) Pros: Great location, right on the ocean, with the sound of breaking waves coming in through your bedroom window. Very friendly and helpfull staff. Just ask, and it gets done. No hassles and with a smile. Roomy bedrooms, lots of extras (refridgerator, coffee machine, micro wave, iron and ironing board). Free parking round the side Free Internet with good connection in all the rooms. Cons: Very little really. If I could improve anything it would be the heater in the room. It either blasts out very hot air or it just doesn´t heat at all. It´s also pretty noisy and in March you need a heater at nights. No food at all. OK, this is not a surprise but it would be nice to have at least breakfast available. All in all, a great stay and I thoroughly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: palmtree42
Reviews.Content: there is nothing better than waking up in a comffy bed and hearing the sound of the crashing waves;having a cup of coffee and taking a long walk along the cliffs.Just gorgeous

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: felipej
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of spending two nights in this lovely inn. Nice comfy bed overlooking the beach, close to some good bars and fun shops. Try OB's Smoothie bar absolutely amazing breakfast drinks, shots of wheatgrass and delicious Acai berries. Receptionist was very pleasant, room well serviced. Good waves too!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: JClay55
Reviews.Content: Found this place via reviews on Tripadvisor and couldn't have been happier with our choice. Although it wasn't slap bang in the centre of San Diego, the location was perfect for our short visit to the city. Only a short taxi ride into town, but we preferred being by the sea. There are also lots of things to see and do on the doorstep (seaworld very close, as well as a worthwhile drive along the cliffs to the nearby national park area). Our room was a bit on the small side, but the bed was large and very comfortable and the decor was contemporary and very clean. By far the best thing, however, was sitting on the deck watching the incredible sunsets - spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Stay-cation”
Reviews.Author: ScubaRy
Reviews.Content: Living in San Diego is treasure enough, however we do get creative from time to time and enjoy a "night away" in our very own backyard. The Inn at Sunset Cliffs was an excellent place to celebrate our "stay-cation." We had arrived very close to midnight and were met with a welcoming smile (no yawns) at the front desk. The hotel is Santorini-esque with its blue and white exterior, beautiful manicured garden, pool and two decks overlooking the ocean. If you could get any closer, you would actually be swimming. Insert sex, drugs and rock and roll....oh wait that's Vegas..... The Inn is cozy, clean and an excellent place to relax and enjoy the, well you know what I am going to say, sunset. The room we had was located in the back of the hotel and felt as if we had our own bungalow. They have recently renovated their rooms and did a wonderful job while paying attention to detail. Although, my only complaint, and I blame them not me, the shelves are located right above the toilet.....and my face soap and lotion was sacrificed to the toilet gods. I imagine any other functioning human being that is not, well me, will not have this problem. Overall, I would absolutely recommend this property to visitors and residents alike, there are great views, quiet rooms, walking distance to restaurants and beach shops. We really enjoyed our stay and looking forward to our next visit, although we plan to upgrade to the president's suite, which I hear has a jacuzzi that overlooks the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and will be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: Cosmo1255
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Inn at Sunset Cliffs with my two young sons, my nephew and my parents. The property was is a great location, with beautiful views of the Ocean. They had everything we needed; it was clean and within minutes of Sea World (which was our main reason for the visit). The staff was accommodating, we had the pleasure to meet the manager Gavin and several other employees during our stay and they were all very friendly. We know where we plan to stay on our next trip back to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back for sure. Lovely stay.”
Reviews.Author: joyfullsky
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay here. Nice and helpful staff. The patio was our favorite hangout. We loved all of the fresh flowers too. It was definitely worth the extra $ to upgrade to the king room upstairs. the veiw was incredible! There were a few details that could have bumped it up to a 5 but its not even worth mentioning. Cant wait to come back. Also, they had coupons for the OB bike rentals for $10 per day, excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Cuuute place!!!”
Reviews.Author: ehere
Reviews.Content: Seriously, this beach motel is darling! Great location right on Sunset Cliffs, cheery blue and white exterior, beautiful flower gardens in the interior courtyard/pool area (kudos to the gardener!), spotless room (new beds would be nice, though; they're a bit, uhhh, noisy), friendly/helpful staff, excellent wifi. We're SD locals and only stayed for July 4th -- great view of the fireworks at OB pier from the motel's lower cliffside terrace. We grilled steaks on the propane bbq (there's a charcoal BBQ, too; as well as a wood burning fire pit on the lower terrace). Guests were a mixture of young couples and large family groups, and despite the holiday, there was just a good, mellow, relaxed fun vibe (no party wildness). Perfect. This is not a chain motel (always nice to support local businesses), and OB itself is a funky beach town in the real old-school sense. If you understand and embrace those things, you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: AKtoAZ
Reviews.Content: Where to start....ok, got it! The view is AMAZING, the staff is FRIENDLY, the location is CONVENIENT, the town of Ocean Beach is FUN and FUNKY, the flowers at the hotel are SPECTACULAR, the hotel room is SPOTLESS, and the pool is REFRESHING! Being from Phoenix, I've been to San Diego a million times, but we always stay at Mission Beach, Pacific Beach or La Jolla. This was our first time to OB and our first stay at the Inn at Sunset Cliffs and now i'm hooked! I can't imagine going back to the other side now that we've discovered this amazing Inn! Go explore Point Loma...cool tide pools and awesome views! For dinner we loved Nicks for seafood (and the pulled pork sandwich is very good too) and Ortegas for Mexican food. Ortegas is a little restaurant with only 5 booths so go early or b prepared to wait. We went at 5 pm on a Saturday and got right in no problem.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for both relaxation and accessing all San Diego has to offer.”
Reviews.Author: Easyflyer
Reviews.Content: As an extended family (grandparents, parents, and two girls, 6 and 9) we booked two rooms for three nights. The rooms are two bedroom suites with a sitting room and with refrigerators and microwaves. We've stayed at this property twice previously, although many years ago. The inn is literally on the edge of the Pacific coast with surf breaking on Sunset Cliffs not more than 10 feet past the end of a patio. The girls loved watching the surf, observing the effects of the changing tides, and the sea lion that was sunning itself on a large rock until the breaking waves urged it off. The swimming pool was nicely heated. The location, while on the edge of the coast, is convenient to Sea World (about 2-3 miles), the airport (about 3 miles), Point Loma, the harbor area, Balboa Park, etc. The girls summed up their visit this way, "We love this hotel!" (We all did, too.)Everything was clean, worked well, and the relaxing atmosphere was excellent. There is also a public transit bus stop directly across the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation place”
Reviews.Author: Dragonfly725
Reviews.Content: My family and I LOVE the Inn especially Gavin, Liz and Alex, they are considered part of the family. I was married there Aug 2009 and my son will be married there this Sept 2011. The veiws are amazing, my husband & I feel like it's our home away from home. We always spend 2 to 3 wks there vacationing with family and friends coming and going, just like having our own place in SD. ALL of the staff is fabulous. Rooms are always clean. We would never go anywhere else in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore bad reviews, this place is AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: medicpatrick
Reviews.Content: As I have been reading past reviews, it makes me wonder why anyone would ever give this place a bad review. January 2011 was my 10th stay at the Inn, and I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else in San Diego. Gavin, Liz and the other members of the management team are probably the most professional and courteous staff I have seen at a hotel. The view from the lower terrace is unbelievable, and I dare someone to say they have a better view of the sunset. There is a little private beach about a block away, plenty of room for playing football or just relaxing. I would definitely suggest renting a beach cruiser, its a great ride (approx 1 mile) to Newport Ave. There they have a bunch of little shops and my favorite fish taco place, South Beach Grill!! There is some villas right next door where they have weddings just about every weekend. You won't even notice them unless you walk over there. I love this place and can't wait to get married there in September!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VIEW/ LOUSY CLEANLINESS”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler49117
Reviews.Content: WE arrived in a hurry to get to an event. I pulled back the bedspread and there was BLACK HAIR on the sheets.later I found some more hair on the living room table. Chris, the staff member, offered to move us to a 2brd if we paid more??? It wasn't our fault their cleaning help screwed up..why should we pay more?????? Finally he offered clean sheets. He tried to hand them to us to put on but we shook our head and he put them on. Alex later fixed the remote so I guess some of them can get it right.. Not a good place for light sleepers..Wedding next door was noisy on Friday unitl 2am..SAturday they were all tired so they quit at 11pm. Bathrooms redone, new beds are needed..Staff cleaned our breakfast dishes but had a big sign for "tips please"..Need better training and management..Good location..GREAT VIEWS..

Reviews.Title: “The most relaxing getaway in san diego!”
Reviews.Author: emuscha
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the Inn at Sunset Cliffs, and it definitely won't be my last! The location is the best in the area. Breathtaking views and peaceful solitude. My first night was in the King Studio. Nothing better than waking up to the sound AND view of crashing waves. The 2nd occassion, I stayed in the1 bedroom Kitchen Suite and enjoyed it just the same. This time, I fell asleep to the sound of the courtyard fountain. The rooms were always exceptionally clean, linens extremely soft, and decor exceptionally quaint. The double headed showers were a personal favorite of mine! The courtyard was full of beautiful flowers that added a nice finishing touch to the whole experience :)

Reviews.Title: “No reason to go anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: MrHarris25
Reviews.Content: I've definitely made this my home away from home. This last time I was booking my business trip to San Diego I had decided to try another place just to see if I could discover another great get-a-way hotel. I won't say which one, but I checked into a very nice upscale hotel in the downtown and checked out the next morning to go back to The Inn at Sunset Cliffs. It's in an area that's just unbeatable. It's got the most amazing view of any of the hotels I've seen in Southern California, and a great helpful staff. The outside patio is a little beat up, but they make do with nice tables and chairs to enjoy the view. The rooms all look as if they've just been remodeled recently, and the location is a very laid back coffee shop/bakery type neighborhood. Love it, and hope you guys can find this place as lovely as I did.

Reviews.Title: “don't believe those pictures!”
Reviews.Author: sallygolightly
Reviews.Content: This is really a motel with a nice view of the ocean. Rooms are very small, the pool is the size of a postage stamp. I found the internet pictures terribly misleading. Everything is much smaller than it appears. There is no beach access and no access at all to the water from the hotel. You can get access from public paths but they make for difficult walking. I enjoyed the neighbourhood, very residential and very pretty. Management was as unhelpful as they could possibly be, rude, unpleasant for a single woman traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry - not for me”
Reviews.Author: Heather_and_Jon
Reviews.Content: Firstly, we never actaully stayed at the Inn as we checked in and out within the hour. I booked three nights here almost a year in advance based on the reviews but Sunset Cliffs just wasn't for us. Firstly location - we thought the whole area was shabby and down at heel, we were advised that there are no restaurants within walking distance and the trip to Downtown and the Gaslight Quarter took over half an hour in the car and this was just too far for us. The Inn itself looked old and run down, grey pebble dash and lots of rust, this was really off putting as we drove up. We were booked with our two children into a large suite (more of an apartment) which looked adequate and clean but quite soulless and not at all attractive. We decided immediately not to stay. The staff, on the other hand, were great. I explained we did not want to be so far out and they offered their help in finding alternative accomodation. I paid for one night (I do think the price was very expensive for the quality of the accomodation) and we went to the Bayfront Hilton which we loved.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Oceanbeach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maxmanmom
Reviews.Content: We (an adult and two teenage boys) just returned from a week long stay. We booked about 6 months in advance and got a bargain rate on a 2 bedroom unit. There was a wedding, but we weren't bothered by noise because were on the second floor on the other side of the property. Slept each night to the sound of the waves. The best part of the hotel is the fantastic location, right on the ocean, with the waves crashing below.The Sunset Cliffs Natural Park is right up the road, perfect for a walk along the ocean cliffs. However, I ended up spending a fair amount of time driving the teens to Mission/Pacific Beach where they wanted to hang out. (Let me tell you driving in San Diego is not for the timid driver.) I appreciated the peace and loveliness of the location more than the boys did, but they enjoyed the pool and building a fire down by the ocean at night. Staff was friendly and helpful, and the rooms were clean (I added extra tips for the housekeepers and they were extremely attentive.) Free wi-fi was a great benefit. The furniture in the rooms could be updated. We did not have a kitchen but the property has a grill available, and the room had a mini fridge, and lots of good restaurants are close by (try Pepe's for Italian.) When we were there we saw many families with very young children who seemed to be enjoying themselves. The gardens are beautiful, and the whole place is very laid back and relaxed, with two friendly little dogs running around greeting the guests and looking for handouts. I'm definitely planning on booking another stay here, but maybe next time I'll leave the teenagers at home.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation I've had in a while!”
Reviews.Author: SmithFamily13
Reviews.Content: Not only is this a beautiful hotel with one of the most spectacular views you could imagine- but the staff are extremely kind and helpful. Checking in was a breeze and front desk worker, Liz, was able to provide lots of great information as to good restuarants to eat at, local places to see and attractions for the kids. She really took the time to make sure that all of our needs were met and that we were enjoying out stay. This kind of attentiveness is rare these days and it was nice to have a staff that was so willing to help us enjoy our time.

Reviews.Title: “Average motel with extraordinary view”
Reviews.Author: dabbler45
Reviews.Content: As most reviews state, the view of the sunset from this location is five star (at least) and there are comfortable chairs and lounges to watch from. Except for the location, though, this is a 3 or 3 1/2 star motel. It's clean and comfortable, a little worn, especially on the outside, and the units are very variable in terms of size and view. We were on the second floor with good views of the ocean. I would think the first floor could also be noisy depending on who is in the unit above. The price reflects the location, not the accomodation. I am not sure whether I'd recommend this place or not.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: katielove
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Inn at sunset cliffs for 2 nights and I wished we had booked our stay for longer. Starting out, the staff was very friendly and welcoming. We asked for a full ocean view room and that is exactly what we got! And the view was spectacular. I have never seen such beautiful sunsets. Our room was perfectly clean and quite cozy. We laid out by the pool one afternoon and I actually fell asleep in the sun! It was just a quick drive or a nice walk to shopping and dining, and there was even a quaint little cafe right next to the hotel where we got lunch one day. We are already planning to go back next summer! I would highly recommend this hotel to couples, families, or anyone looking for a getaway to a beautiful location for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: mg1072
Reviews.Content: Sunset Inn at the Cliffs was exactly what we were looking for. It was my partner and I, plus a 19yr old and 5 yr old. I can assure you we all were extremely satisfied.The rooms were all clean as well as the grounds. All the employees were very helpful and kind our entire stay. The different level terraces were absolutely perfect! we sat many mornings and evenings looking onto the ocean. You're close enough to nearby shops, beaches, and parks, but just far enough to stay away from all the noise and chaos. It was a great vacation at a reasonable price. We were very happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “View is just awe-inspiring. Hotel is good, not great.”
Reviews.Author: PatsFanAlex
Reviews.Content: First of all: wow. This view is just amazing. Watching the waves crash from the deck was one of those experiences you never forget. Second: high-end motel. Great value. We had a 1BR + Kitchen. Perfect for our little guy. No tourist trap type deals. Staff tried hard, kind of under-trained. Free wifi and parking. How can we complain? Third: A few kinks. Place is noisy. People upstairs sound like a stampede. Wedding parties etc going on at rental property next door (literally 10 ft from our room). Fourth: Great location. OB is a cool neighborhood. Lots of quick and convenient meal options in walking distance. We had awesome breakfast burritos and fish tacos. Fifth: San Diego is just amazing. San Diego Zoo, Balboa Park (Puppet Show! Air and Space museum, sculpture garden, etc), amazing beaches, Coronado, La Jolla, Wild Animal Park. Can not go wrong. Anyone living in SD is incredibly lucky. Don't miss the fish tacos @ Point Loma Seafood Company.

Reviews.Title: “Yet again this place was amazing. Had the...”
Reviews.Author: Burlystud34
Reviews.Content: Yet again this place was amazing. Had the north corner room, to the right when you walk up the main stairs. 2 bedrooms, kitchen, and living room, it was like a home away from home. This was my second stay and this time was even more pleasent than the first. Management and staff could not be more on the ball. Before I even noticed there was no soap in the shower, staff had some in hand for me minutes after I settled into my casa for the weekend. A real 10 star place.

Reviews.Title: “Blew me off my feet completely”
Reviews.Author: MrHarris25
Reviews.Content: Not only are the staff fun, talkative and helpful; but the place is in a just stunning location. The insides of the rooms are beautiful and comfty. The area around it is perfect. You can enjoy nice walks outside the downtown. There are bars and restaurants close by with lots of life. They have the farmers market sometimes. And the view on their terraces are amazing. They aren't on the beach like the other hotels. They're on the water. The water touches the hotel. This was my third or fourth time staying here and every time it has gotten better. Plus getting to know the neighborhood has lead me to some cool spots I now frequent when I come. I've stayed in the double queens room twice, and it was beautiful and clean! And now I have stayed in the Presidential Suite twice. A little expensive, but very worth it on special occasions. Unbelievable view, jacuzzi, incredible interior. It is just an overall spectacular place to stay when you have this room. P.s. I've found leaving the friendly housekeeping a couple bucks really gets them to do a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience - stunning view, great value, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: JLHK1234
Reviews.Content: Best view of the sunset I've ever seen - right on the cliffs over the ocean. You can enjoy the sunset on one of the 2 decks over the ocean or walk along the cliffs. Property is well manicured with lovely gardens. Location is excellent - near major restaurants, Gas Lamp and Sea World. The rooms are remodeled and very nice with a very warm and friendly staff. Overall great value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Never again.”
Reviews.Author: DHL888
Reviews.Content: View is gorgeous. Gardens are lovely. Pool is small. Rooms are redone aged motel. Beds are good quality. Culture of the staff is that it is incumbent upon the customer to tell them what they need when there is a problem and not incumbent upon the staff to initiate or be energetic/enthusiastic about solving the problems. And the problems I experienced were EGREGIOUS: the floors were dirty, found a long black hair on my pillow, the showerheads were not adjustable and spewed strong water horizontally across the shower, three piles of dog poop on the lawn outside our room went unpicked up for a day, the closet smelled moldy (the only place to hang the designer dress I'd bought for the wedding I was to attend!), the pricey ocean-"view" room did face the ocean but could not be seen from inside due to the small high windows AND the stairway that was adjacent to the windows (everyone upstairs walked up and down these stairs looking directly into my room!), and FINALLY THE WORST: when donning the bathrobe in the morning to head to the pool, I found an unwashed pack of used matches in the pocket: THE BATHROBE HAD BEEN WORN BEFORE AND NOT WASHED FOR MY STAY!!!! ICK. The staff responded to this extremely casually, did wash the robe and return it to my room, but NEVER offered to compensate me in any way. When talking with the manager the following Tuesday (first chance to catch him and I had to initiate the call even after an email to him delineating the problems!), he also was extremely casual, never offered to comp a night or offer me a free future night (traditional hotelier solutions), but went on at length about how he agreed with the items that were problems and how he'd fixed them or would fix them. NEVER ONE WORD about me the customer, about fixing my negative experience with him. When I finally said something about how cavalier they are and that any other hotel would offer me a comped night, he became extremely passive-aggressive and said that had I asked him for this at the outset, he would have comped me a night, in fact he would have comped me the whole weekend AND given me a future stay for free; but now that I was a bad customer (what?! I listened to him drag on for 20 minutes about his hotel!), he would not do a thing for me and in fact advised me that I was banned from his hotel. ROTLFMAO. Like I would EVER return! I then advised him that this was the problem with the staff culture at the hotel: they think it's incumbent upon the customer to pay them AND to advise them how to perform. I advised him that in the hotel industry it is, in fact, incumbent upon the hotelier to serve the customer who is paying them. So if you stay here be sure to 1. bring up every problem you have immediately with the staff when you discover it and have them fix it asap and maybe comp you a night if you have the seriously disgusting problems I had and 2. be sure to never indict the staff for their laissez faire attitude and responses or you'll get blamed for being an inadequate customer.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: liftedhummersut
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving to the hotel we were greated by friendly staff as well as taking in the amazing views offered including beatiful gardens and breathtaking sunsets. Staff was very professional and accomadating. We had an amazing stay and would strongly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Chrisman2k
Reviews.Content: A friend told me about this hotel and said I would love it, and he was right! It's right on the water, breath taking sunsets, and best of all, you can hear the ocean at all times, which lets you sleep like a baby. When you step out of your door, there is the ocean in all its beauty, and there is a lounge area so you can enjoy your morning cup of coffee, share a glass of wine durring sunset if you bring that special some one, or if you just choose to put your feet up and relax. Rooms are clean and updated, hot water never runs out, and overall very comfortable. I would recomend a stay here to anyone at any time.

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zonxyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Inn at Sunset Cliffs with a couple of friends to finish off our New Years celebration in a relaxing environment with the ocean near by. We were all extremely pleased with the accommodations and the friendly staff. The rooms are homey, clean and comfortable. The patio on the cliffs is absolutely breathtaking! I would highly recommend this place for anybody, family, couples, or friends looking for a weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, relaxed atmosphere...”
Reviews.Author: spacenjay
Reviews.Content: Amazing location, relaxed atmosphere. We've found our new favorite hotel in San Diego! Coffee on the cliffs every morning and sunsets by the pool every night prompted us to extend our vacation an extra day and stay another night. The suites are like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: micheleg73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here March 25-29. Had to change rooms during stay based on availability when I booked. First three nights had two room suite with lots of room to spread out. Last night had pool-side queen newly renovated & beautiful bathroom with dual head shower. Spent lots of time sitting outside on upper deck watching the waves crashing & splashing up onto lower deck while eating breakfast & enjoying fabulous sunsets. Comfortable outdoor teak furniture with cushions to enjoy the view. Great location next to Sunset Cliffs park & could see Ocean Beach Pier from hotel balcony. Could see & hear ocean waves from hotel bedrooms. Pleasant staff & beautiful flowers on bed when you check in. Lots of beautiful flower gardens everywhere outside. Located in Ocean Beach & close to all San Diego attractions. Free parking!!

Reviews.Title: “Come for the View; Leave because of the Service”
Reviews.Author: rodeo_queen_702
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here while visiting friends in San Diego for the weekend. The ocean-front motel is located in a cozy corner of the Ocean Beach neighborhood and offers spectacular ocean views. Regrettably, thats about it. Upon checking-in, we were disappointed to see no less that three dogs running loose around the grounds of what we thought was a "pet free" motel (my husband is terribly allergic to dogs) . Later during our stay the toilet overflowed and the girl from the front desk with whom we spoke with was very rude and tried to blame a plumbing malfunction on us (we just checked in??). On Sunday we tried to read the paper and relax on the sun-deck but were put-off by an obscene amount of seagull droppings. The girl at the front desk was again very rude when we asked if this could be cleaned up (do you even know how much bacteria is in bird dropping??? gross!). We didn't even bother complaining about the spotty wi-fi service based on the attitude the hotel staff gave us. Save your money and stay and close to the beach (not on it). You will be able to enjoy the views from any of the many other scenic locations around town.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: StefaniMarie
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Inn at Sunset Cliffs in San Diego and had an amazing time! I was with my husband and our twin 2 years old girls and I couldnt have asked for a better experience. All of the staff were friendly, curtious, welcoming etc. We enjoyed one of their 2 bedroom suites with the kitchen unit. How convienent was that!! We were able to get some snacks and drinks for the girls, they had a huge fridge, dishes and everything we needed! Overall I would say this place was a one of a kind experience and having traveled to other places in San Diego we will definately be staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay at Sunset”
Reviews.Author: MrHarris25
Reviews.Content: It's a nice little place on the edge of the water in Ocean Beach. There are other nice hotels, but it's hard to find a nice quiet location with fewer people. This place was perfect. Nothing over the top, but everything has just been refurnished and the staff are amazing. I would say among all of the trips I've had to San Diego (which can easily be in the 20s) this hotel was my favorite. It was just what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: “what a gorgeous setting”
Reviews.Author: palmtree42
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the inn and was greeted by Gavin and Kruz. The grounds were spectacular. The beds were the best I've ever slept on; and going to sleep listening to the waves crashing on the cliffs was so soothing. I would highly recommend this Inn to anyone who truly wants to enjoy the beaches. Cindy Giorgi northern Ca.

Reviews.Title: “Million dollar views and the comfort of home, without spending a million dollars!”
Reviews.Author: PapaCubano
Reviews.Content: Amazing views and service, romantic and simple. The hotel is definitely unique. The rooms are clean and comfortable. This didn't feel like a hotel it felt like you had a condo by the beach. Being a smaller hotel it never feels crowded, in fact it feels like you own the place. All rooms are poolside and you hear the waves as you fall asleep. Viewing deck with areas to eat and sit while overlooking the sunset or sunrise... I could go on and on. Very happy with my stay and looking forward to my next.

Reviews.Title: “I've been to over a dozen hotels in SD...”
Reviews.Author: Burlystud34
Reviews.Content: I've been to over a dozen hotels in SD and this is by far the greatest I've stayed at. Cozy, afordable, and best view in town. Will be coming back very soon!!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel i've stayed at in san diego!”
Reviews.Author: joeymagnelli
Reviews.Content: great service, beautiful views and amazing rooms. the people that work there are super friendly and next time i go back to san diego i will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: julydog
Reviews.Content: The views from our room were great, although the room was a little shabby and very small. The coffee pot kept spilling when you poured it, so we used a white towel to clean up the desk where the coffee had spilled. Upon check out, they charged us $30 for the towels. They said we could take them with us if we wanted. I had tried many ways to keep the coffee from spilling when poured from the pot and finally poured over the sink. I do not think we should have been charged for the towels, there seemed to be something in the coffee pot design that caused it to spill when poured. It seems to me that the white towels could have easily been laundered, it was only one or two towels we used and had nothing else available to clean up the spills.

Reviews.Title: “Best Sunset Views Ever”
Reviews.Author: leeny981
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Inn at Sunset Cliffs with my mother while she was in town for my Masters graduation. I was living in Ocean Beach, so I knew about the Inn but had never stayed there or didn't know much about it. Sunset Cliffs are my favorite part about San Diego and this hotel epitomizes why. The Sunset views are *perfect* and it is SO relaxing!! It is not very far from the airport (about a 10 minute drive through the back roads), it is in a quiet location where you can relax and not worry about drunk kids stumbling home from the bars, and service is pretty good. I would definitely recommend this for a short stay. You need a car to get here unless you want to take the public bus system which probably drops you off within walking distance. Ocean Beach is also a GREAT town in San Diego where you will definitely meet some characters, but you will get a feel for what San Diego is really like. :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, charming place!”
Reviews.Author: bruinsurfer
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Sunset Cliffs is just an absolutely perfect place for a romantic getaway. The scenery being right on the coast overlooking the ocean is breathtaking and beautiful. The people in the office were very friendly. We pretty much stayed at the Inn the entire time, except taking the short walk to the Point Loma Beach Cafe for breakfast and lunch, excellent, very reasonably priced food. The two-bedroom suite was spacious enough. The double-fixture shower was great and roomy. The sunset was gorgeous. The weather was perfect. We can't wait to return there again. We were able to get the room at a reduced rate on booking.com, but the people in the office said that next time to call them to book and they'll give us the best rate possible. We're looking forward to the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Glorius Stay - Beauty, Comfort, Bliss!!!! Oh, so Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: LIPSTrips
Reviews.Content: I truly cannot say enough about this vacation place. Waking up to the beautiful ocean and gardens was just breathtaking. The staff was welcoming and took care of all our needs. Felt like I was at my favorite family home somewhere in Paradise. so much more comfortable than staying at a huge hotel with elevators and huge parking lots full of cars, traffic and too many people. Betsy, Mary and I had our special moments for early morning coffee and sunrise to the ocean-front patio with our warm and toasty fire and wine for the gorgeous sunsets. Thank you Gavin and Matt!!!! Great times for us. And kiss "Kruz" for us too. We will certainly be back one day with all our L.I.P.S Friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot but...”
Reviews.Author: Triplefff
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a weekend here and the spot was just great. Wonderful view, great location. We had both the King suite on the end for two nights, and the Presedential suite for two nights. Both were very comfortable and well appointed. The grounds are lovely with lots of flowers and Cruise the miniature doberman was always fun to play with. If I had one complaint its the pricing. Seems to be a bit too expensive, and I didn't get my fourth night free since I had changed rooms, which seemed to break the rules. Rather than fight about it and ruin our stay, just went with the flow.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Couples”
Reviews.Author: cpswife
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay! The views were absolutely beautiful. The staff was all very friendly and helpful with directions. There is a walking path just in front of the hotel and you walk the cliffs for miles along the beach. Perfect for couples wanting a romantic place to get away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family...stunning views.....friendly staff......charming”
Reviews.Author: mominNOLA
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the San Diego area from the greater New Orleans area. First time we stayed in Carlsbad, but since husband had meeting to attend downtown we decided on The Inn at Sunset Cliffs. We drove to Legoland 2 days which was about 40 minutes away. Glad we decided to stay at this charming location. Everything else we did was close to the downtown area and this location was ideal, about 10 or 15 minute drive. It was so much better than being in a giant high rise hotel downtown. Plus no matter what you would pay elsewhere, you could never get these views. AMAZING..!! Sound of waves crashing all night, ocean breezes, pool for the kids, safe area and a friendly staff. This isn't the Waldorf Astoria, but that's not why you should choose this hotel anyway. Prices aren't way off the charts. I've paid the same & more at hotels in other cities and had fancier rooms, but NEVER had this view. We had a 2 bedroom suite on the second floor with a living room. T.V. in living room and 1 of the bedrooms. Small fridge and microwave. Entire stay was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families or anyone else.”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoBeachnik
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Inn at Sunset Cliffs with my boyfriend and our three kids ages 8, 12, and 15. They gave us a 2-bedroom suite with a kitchen. It was very comfortable, clean, and the grounds are charming. Nice small pool and patio area for watching the ocean. It's in a nice quiet area, away from the bars and crowds on Newport, but there is a store that has basics right across the street and a wonderful little cafe for breakfast or lunch almost next door. The staff are very friendly and welcoming. Prices are reasonable too. This is a good place to stay with kids, but would also love to go back sometime with just my boyfriend and stay in the room with the hot tub! This is a wonderful little independent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience with spectacular service”
Reviews.Author: mjeberst
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week in August, and highly enjoyed it. The view of the cliffs and ocean from the patio was amazing. The service was spectacular as well. The hotel manager was very cordial and very accomodating to all our needs. The rooms were beautiful, comfortable, and very well kept. Housekeeping staff was very pleasant. If you are going to San Diego, this hotel is a hidden jewel with awesome views and amazing accommadations. Completely made our vacation!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place I have EVER stayed. Utter magic.”
Reviews.Author: KMCanberra
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably good, and treat yourself to the upstairs room at the front - the King Suite. It's worth every single cent. The surf is right outside the window and it booms and crashes all night! Rooms are simple and 'beachy', painted pale pastel blue which is perfect for the blue sea and blue sky which fill the view through the big windows. It's hard to describe just what a perfect place this is - suffice to say that our plans to 'do things in San Diego' went out the window when we checked in, we just spent the whole of the next day in the pool and on the sun-lounges, watching the surf and marvelling at the magnificence of it all. The garden around the pool is lovingly tended, and the whole place feels really nice. An absolute gem.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a better location in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: tmacinsd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the cliffs in Ocean Beach. I used to live down the street and always used to run by this little hotel. Now that I live out of town I finally got the opportunity to stay here. It was great! Nice location on Pacific Ocean, nice rooms (we had a two bedroom suite), not to mention I was able to enjoy the sunset with friends and beer (alcohol now illegal at San Diego beaches). I opened the window and fell asleep and woke up to the ocean waves crashing on the cliffs. (Very relaxing). I would stay here again and would recommend to my out of town friends and family. If the price was a little cheaper I would stay here every time I visit friends in OB. I guess you can't have it all!

Reviews.Title: “No Sunset”
Reviews.Author: Dynartw
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I drove from LA to San Diego and decided to stay one night at Sunset Cliffs to experience the more beachy side of San Diego before staying in the city for the new year. While driving into San Diego there was fog on the coast which had just happened that day. Due to this we were unable to experience the beautiful sunset at the cliffs as we couldn't even see the cliffs. However the hotel was great and very clean. We walked a short distance up the road and there was a drug store, resturants, liquor store so we were all set. There is also a gas station and great cafe just next door to the hotel so we had all we needed. It is a great location just on the edge of the town with what I expect to be amazing views.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Cure for the East Coast Winter Blues”
Reviews.Author: neenabird
Reviews.Content: My husband found this hotel on Trip advisor, and we booked through orbitz. I have to say the Inn at Sunset Cliffs is amazing. The views alone make the whole trip worth it. It was our first time visiting California and I have to say we were impressed! We booked the King Suite and as I said above the views are amazing! You can here the waves crashing against the cliffs and that totally puts you in a relaxed state of mind. The room was very spacious and clean. The bed was unbelievably comfortable. The bathroom is beautiful! Granite and glass with a double shower head which make you feel like you are at a spa! The staff at Sunset Cliffs are very nice and professional. This was a perfect trip from start to finish, I definitely plan on coming back next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: beachyLa
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved The Inn at Sunset Cliffs. I went there on a mini vacation for myself and this hotel was everything that I could have hoped for. I stayed in a poolside queen which was much bigger than the pictures made it seem. It was clean, had an extremely comfortable bed, a fridge, and the best part . . . a shower with 2 shower heads. That was just the room. When I walked outside, I saw the best view of the ocean. It was so beautiful and peaceful. The staff was also very friendly and accomodating. I will definitely be coming back. I loved it and would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Memorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: MarianBMesa
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Inn and absolutely loved every minute of it! We had a 2 bedroom w/kitchenette which was very clean and well furnished. The suite was like staying in your own apartement - very comfortable. The staff there was excellent and the housekeeping department went out of their way to meet all of your needs. And they all did it with a smile on their faces! But what a beautiful place to work! The flowers were all in bloom and one staff member spent the day caring just for the landscaping. We had a fire one night on the lower patio, watched the sunset every night, enjoyed the pool, the putting green and just the relaxing feeling there. We will DEFINITELY go back! And soon.....

Reviews.Title: “Great for sunset lovers”
Reviews.Author: OlafR
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights with the family there. First, we were offered an appartment in the south wing ground floor. This was dark and cold. Moisture and smell. Window View on the garbage bins of the neighbours. We complained and got a 1st floor appartment in the north wing. This was much much better. Light and fresh air. Rooms were not particularly bad but nth special. Clean and dry. All in all a good price/performance ratio. Great is the short walk to the cliffs just before sunset. Just make sure you dont get the groundfloor in the south wing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View, Friendly Staff & Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: cnzpete
Reviews.Content: I met my family members for a vacation in San Diego and we stayed at The Inn at Sunset Cliffs. It was awesome! The employees always make sure you have everything that you need, which makes the vacation so much more enjoyable. The view from the room was spectacular. Like the flower garden near the pool, the surfers and boaters battling the waves, and the sunset over the ocean. And of course the weather, always perfect! There is no question, this will be the hotel of choice for my family from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal right next to the ocean”
Reviews.Author: msavellano
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a little getaway. The poolside queen is really small. The bed literally took the entire space. The bathroom has dual showerheads and the decoration felt more modern than the bedroom. Hotel room came with microwave, fridge and a coffeemaker, not the best one in pouring however. But the view of the ocean was awesome. The outside of the hotel had a pool, fountain and a little green area to golf along with patio furniture. Once you take the steps towards the ocean, it was quite amazing. Definitely a good deal for only 150 per night. Sea world and other attractions were about a 5-10 minute drive. The location was nearby a bunch of residential areas and not enough restaurants. But, I guess thats what you get for paying that much. Service was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Rooms less than desirable”
Reviews.Author: kgendron
Reviews.Content: I checked out The Inn at Sunset Cliffs to potentially accomodate wedding guests... The location is absolutely amazing but the rooms are pretty shabby. With such an amazing location, you'd think they'd put some money into the rooms and fix it up a bit. Not bad for the money but not great either. Stay somewhere else and make sure to visit the Sunset Cliffs area for the great views.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for the Best Price”
Reviews.Author: kcwebbah
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a weekend getaway in February. Overall, it was a really great weekend away and we would stay here again. Here are some comments/observations from our stay. View: Beautiful!!! The inn is located right on the cliffs and every room has some sort of view of the ocean. The rooms are located on top of a small cliff and there is nothing obstructing your view north towards Ocean Beach (and beyond) or south. This is the reason we liked this hotel. I don't think there is any other hotel in this price range that even comes close to this one in San Diego (and maybe anywhere in SoCal). Room: We booked a Poolside Queen room, but since the pool was under construction, we were upgraded to a Two Bedroom Suite on the second floor 3 rooms from the ocean end of the north wing. The room was adequately furnished and clean. The bathroom had a dual head shower which was a nice touch and you could look out the shower window and see the ocean. Not quite as cool as an in room hot tub (like the Presidential Suite) but better than nothing! Definitely request a room as close to the water as possible and on the second level for the best view for your buck. Ammenities: Well, the pool was closed when we were there but it was still a little chilly anyways. The "breakfast" was pretty sparse; fruit, mini muffins, bagels, coffee and Sunny Delight. I think they are supposed to serve Belgian Waffles on the weekends but they definitely didn't when we were there. A small disappointment because I was looking forward to those. The wireless internet didn't seem to want to work for us (I think their router might be broken) but they have a computer in the lobby that was available to use for free. They have firepits! They have wood and lighters available for you to make your own little bonfire on the lower deck right next to the ocean. We made two fires while we were there and it was a really fun experience. Service: No complaints, everyone we met was nice. However, do not expect the service you might be used to from a higher star hotel. But for the price you shouldn't expect 4-star service. It's mostly college-aged kids working the front desk. Our rooms were cleaned and no complaints with the housekeeping. Out and about: We went on a walk south of the inn along the cliffs. There is a trail that runs along the cliffs for quite a ways. I think this is one of the most beautiful areas in all of SD. We ate dinner one night in Point Loma at Miguel's Cocina. It is affordable Mexican food with expensive, watered down margaritas and a really great queso dipping sauce that is complimentary and comes with warm tortilla chips. The next night we went big and went to Piatti's in La Jolla. It is a nice Italian food restaurant. Definitely request a seat on their patio, it's really pretty. This is my favorite restaurant in SD. Hopefully this gives you an idea of what to expect by staying here...that's what Trip Advisor is all about!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay there”
Reviews.Author: Psyr
Reviews.Content: I traveled here with another couple and rented out the two bedroom suite with the kitchen. While the cleaning service was a bit lagging, we found the place very comfortable and enjoyed all the amenities (pool, view, outside firepit, etc.). The only drag was that the AC was not powerful enough to keep us cool - we ended up traveling to San Diego during their worst heat wave of the year and had trouble getting a good nights rest due to the heat. The inn is located near the zoo and Seaworld and I would highly recommend it to a family looking for a moderately priced place with a great view. There is only street-side parking at the place, but I did not find parking hard to find during my 4 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Obi
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay in a King Studio Suite and I have really mixed feelings about the stay. The room was clean and spacious with an incredible view, yet the bedding was worn and the air conditioner/heater didn't work. Luckily, the temperature was moderate and we were able to do without. When we went to checkout othe next morning, no one was in the office, so we rang the buzzer as instructed and called the number listed, but no one ever answered. So, overall I feel it is overpriced, but where else can you get a view like that? Just be aware you are paying mostly for the location and the accomodations are average and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “My Favourite Hotel EVER!”
Reviews.Author: beantherePerth
Reviews.Content: Wowee! Romantic couples read this! We went here on our delayed honeymoon. Not for business or families. Beautiful location on the cliffs! Relaxing...,wonderful service. Cute pool in the middle of hotel. The BEST hotel bedding ever! All rooms are good no need to specify, maybe ground floor better?. I ran out of money in my account and they were reallly cool and I transferred funds from the front desk computer (we were at the end of holiday!). It is a place to think and reflect, pure authentic experience- the gorgeous view is all you need. Snug as a bug in a rug.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views”
Reviews.Author: pink1783
Reviews.Content: I had heard about the Inn through Trip Advisor and fell in love with it! My boyfriend and I booked a weekend at the end of June. We stayed in the King Suite. We got there a little early on Friday, and they let us go in before check-in time. The pool is a little smaller than it looks in the virtual tour, but it's okay. The view is spectacular from the deck or from our window in the King Suite. I highly recommend this room. It's sort of small, but worth it, if it's just a couple. The guests at the Inn were all ages. On Saturday and Sunday they made waffles and they had bagels and muffins. Really good waffles! Everyone was very nice. The only thing was that the Internet was down that weekend, so I wasn't able to use the computer, but it was no problem. In walking distance is a convenience store and gas station. If you want to go for a longer walk, you can reach Ocean Beach and shops. When we got there, we went to Hodad's, which had great hamburgers. Overall, love this hotel a lot! Kind of pricey, but would come back in a second. We are thinking about making this a yearly ritual to go to San Diego and stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great view does not make a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cressydoodles
Reviews.Content: I hate to write a bad review because this hotel really tries hard. However I must be honest to my fellow travelers who depend on the facts. Sure the view is great and weekend breakfast was decent (fresh, homemade waffles, and Costco muffins, croissants and bagels, plus some fruit), but the bed linens were a bit shabby, the mattress uncomfortable, and could have used some ceiling fans. The worst was the bathroom. It was very small with no counter top to lay out your toiletries (although there was a cupboard over the toilet with some exterior shelves), plus the water pressure was so strong that it stung the body. Adjusting it to less pressure meant cold water (the warmer, the stronger). Also the shower head went from gushing to needle-like. Bad if you get sunburn. The staff was very pleasant. And the location was great for La Jolla and Old Town. Parking was free because you park on the side street in front of their garage doors. All in all, I probably wouldn't stay here again. I prefered the Embassy Suites San Diego Downtown for room quality (although it was $70 more a night plus $24 parking),

Reviews.Title: “An oasis from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: FifisMommy
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful gem of a hotel. More of a "motel" in some ways (not the fanciest rooms ever, our bathtub didn't have a stopper and one never was found, the pool mysteriously closed after an inspection)... but the view is amazing! Right on the ocean, the traffic dies down at night and you can fall asleep to the sound of the waves. Honestly if this hotel were in any other location, it wouldn't be such a gem, but right on the beach makes it a 9+! Very mellow and relaxed atmosphere. We stayed with our 2 year old and didn't feel that we were annoying any of the other guests at the hotel. At the same time, I saw kids around but didn't hear them so if you are child-less, don't let that put you off. Very nice staff (who didn't always accomodate our needs but were nice enough), good morning coffee, priceless views, great location (close to everything, but felt miles away)... I'd definitely stay here again. As has been mentioned, the kitchenette is a bonus as there really is not too much within walking distance foodwise. Also, the bagel cafe across the street is DISGUSTING so avoid anything there. Better off at the gas station, or bring your own goodies! There was a fridge and micro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Gift”
Reviews.Author: LoloSanDiego
Reviews.Content: When we checked in Cheree found out it was our 26th anniversary we we're upgarded to the King Suite. This room has the views of being on a boat. It was such a relaxing 24 hours. We were lucky that they were not booked that week. We felt like we we're gone for several days. I'd highly recommend this place. The accomodations are not luxurious but extremely cozy and comfortable. The view from the deck is worth it even if you don't get an ocean view room and the hospitality was heartwarming.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Scenery”
Reviews.Author: Sandra76
Reviews.Content: Wow, the location here is beautiful, if a little removed. It's wonderful to hear the ocean at night as you're sleeping. In fact, aside from the waves, the area is very quiet and peaceful. The room was very clean, but a little generic. They do have a computer you can use in the lobby, which is a great amenity. We got a little lost trying to find anywhere to eat or some sort of city center that might have a movie showing. However, the fact that the hotel is a little out-of-the-way is probably what lends to it being so serene. The location really is gorgeous, although the staff were a little lackluster. I would definitely recommend this place overall, but next time I'll book a room with a kitchen so we won't have to travel for food, and spend the extra amount for an oceanfront room.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem on the Ocean!”
Reviews.Author: KY_EnviroGuy
Reviews.Content: Excellent visit! We were only here for one night (due to budget), at the end of a 6-day visit to the San Diego area, but we were not disappointed. We wished we could have stayed longer. It's an awesome experience to have the windows and shades open at night and listen to the surf. And you could look out the window and see the waves in the night. We don't have too much to add that has not been written by the others, except to add that the rooms directly facing the ocean are worth the expense. The only down part of our visit, as has been written elsewhere, is that there are no restaurants nearby, and it's a half-mile hike to a small grocery store. We recommend the short drive to Old Town, in particular, the Zocalo Grill. Also, the front desk attendant could have been more helpful, but no problems there. As stated elsewhere, it is a gem of a small hotel, and nicely understated. We would definitely stay there again if we make it back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Modest and clean but beautiful scenery!”
Reviews.Author: bianca66
Reviews.Content: I really hate to even review this place, simply because it's small and sorta quaint, and I want to be selfish and keep a lot of folks from findng about it! We stayed here the last week of March, starting on a Tuesday, for five nights. Had a 2br suite with NO kitchen. Lovely, uninterrupted view of the ocean and cliffs from both bedroom windows on south side. Overall, the room was clean with very nice linens, extra pillow, a good-sized closet to put your things in. Good-sized fridge and microwave. Bathroom shower had double shower heads, although no counter to put your cosmetics and toiletries. Overall, the hotel itself is modest, but very clean and comfortable. What you're paying for here is the view from the patios, just outside your door, no matter where you are in the hotel. We saw dolphins and seals swimming by almost every morning, and our last morning there, a lone seal pulled himself up to one of the rocks just fifty yeards or so from the lower patio. And, yes, the sunset is spectacular. There is ample seating on both the upper and lower patio for eating, or just ocean-gazing. Furthermore, the location is convenient to anywhere we went in San Diego, whether downtown, Mission Beach, Old Town, or La Jolla. Cabrillo National Monument is right next door to the south and should not be missed. We went tide-pooling there our first day in town. I guess my only quip would be that it's not convenient to a drugstore or grocery or restaurants (that are a short walk, anyway), as it's in a residential neighborhood. We had to drive around looking for restaurants and grocery stores. (There's a Trader Joe's in Point Loma on Rosencrans St.) Also, we were disappointed in both Ocean Beach restaurants we ate at - a little Italian storefront place (can't remember the name) and Nati's, which was actually mentioned in a guidebook. Aside from the mediocre cuisine, though, I really liked the atmosphere of Ocean Beach. Laid-back, a little funky, very SoCal. Overall, our stay here was extremely pleasant. I hated to leave this place, really, and hated to leave San Diego. We are already talking about going back next spring, and we'll definitely book the Inn at Sunset Cliffs again. I'd recommend this hotel to those wishing to be right on the ocean, willing to rent a car to get around San Diego, and who are ok with the casual, somewhat "hippie-fied" atmosphere of Ocean Beach. This is a good place for families with kids too, although there were also a quite a few older people staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, but not luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: jljlalal
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Sunset Cliffs is a quiet little gem. Most of what has been written in previous reviews, I have to concur with. I really love this place, but it is not for everyone. The rooms are clean and spacious, but very basic. The view of the ocean, from anywhere in the hotel, can be seen, but I would imagine that the Ocean suites are to die for. As for us, we had a two bedroom kitchen suite for part of the week, and then we have to move to a two bedroom without a kitchen, due to availability. The front office is very nice and helpful. be aware that the Wifi is down, and has been for a few weeks, but there is a computer in the lobby which you can have access to (and is where I am writing this review!). The pool is small, but lovely and heated. The bedrooms are not air conditioned, which is not a problem for us this week (April 3rd), as the nights are very cool, but may be if you choose to stay here in the summer. The location is great, close to a lot of cute shops and resturants. The noise from the street at night can be a bit annoying, as you are on a busy street (Sunset Cliffs Blvd.) and there are busses and trucks that, for some reason, seem to idle for a while, but our room was located in the worst spot for this. Most other rooms will not have this problem. Overall, I would most certainly stay here again, as i think the value, the view and the service cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “wine by a fire on the ocean....breathtaking!”
Reviews.Author: ccakegrl
Reviews.Content: Not only a stunning location (the hotel is overlooking the ocean and the views and the sunsets everyday are mindblowing) but some of the nicest people working there as well. Coffee everyday in a nice common area with newspapers, and on the weekends fruit and muffins with the coffee. If you ask they will give you the firewood to build a fire in a firepit alongside the ocean! yOu can have a picnic in the night while the waves crash. Amazing. Also, I have never slept better. Im not sure if it was the comfort of the bed, or the soothing sounds of the waves which lull you to sleep. Also Ocean beach is a great little community, laid back and cool and great people. Good restaurants (the vine wine bar, thee bungalow anda nice little gournet shop right down the street from the hotel which was great for picnics). My boyfriend and I stayed here for a week and did not leave the hotel all that much. It was so pretty, and so wonderfully relaxing. (oh and they have internet usage in the common area). What a fab little love nest (we had a basic small room, it was lovely - oh and it has a fridge which is nice!)

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Jem, But Keep In Mind ...”
Reviews.Author: kirk20003
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as her brother lives just up the street. The neighborhood is near Ocean Beach. Its a bohemian area, but growing up quick as you see a lot of young families and couples w/dogs strolling around some cute cottages/digs, but abeit very expensive digs. The hotel is rustic with a 60's/70's flair to it. The rooms have been updated. The "Poolside Queens" are very small but furnished nicely. The bathrooms are very well maintained. For the money ($135/room for poolside queen), you are getting a very good deal. The property sits on the edge of a cliff down to the ocean. No beachside, but cliffside. They have chairs on the patio to hang out and eat your morning bites provided (coffee, tea, bagles, muffins, etc) for free. They have a heated, small pool. The staff is nice. They also have wireless internet. Obviously it was off-season, and not very crowded. Parking was on-street as the few off-street parking they usually provide in the alley is not available due to construction aside the property (no noise). I can see that if the property was filled to capacity and maybe had noiser clients you would hear them in adjoining rooms and above, but it was quiet there. The only surprise we got was checking out and told that our $135/night roommate had a weekend surcharge which is very deceptive. Why not tell us upfront that the real room rate is $10/night more on weekends. We paid this, but thought it was very deceptive. They also tagged phone call to the room that we did not make. Other then this, it was a very nice property and locals can't believe how little the hotel charges!!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Piece of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: donmokhan
Reviews.Content: My lovely other half would like me to take her on romantic getaways every weekend if it were possible. Being sentimentally attached to the San Diego area, I took a chance on this little piece of paradise. The Presidential Suite is... Presidential. A HUGE Plasma screen just for me, beautiful views all round of the Pacific Ocean, and very 70s/Europa style decor. What I appreciated most was how peaceful the location is, tucked away in Point Loma, and I highly recommend acquainting yourself with all of the local restaurants and antique shops. Make sure to eat Mexican at BRAVOS. Pick up some bubbly bath bubbles from that HUGE Beauty Depot across the Street from Bravos, and come back and enjoy that Jacuzzi that can fit 2. It could even fit a man and 2 women but my wife might not appreciate that. For a romantic getaway, this place is it. Go Chargers, Mo Khan

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyGo
Reviews.Content: Perfect location at a good price. We loved the sundowns and our clean and nicely equipped room (which in fact was a suite). Great!

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: brook892
Reviews.Content: We just got back from this wonderful hotel. We had 4 kids and two adults and loved it. It is brand new and beautiful. We had a two bedroom suite with no kitchen. The shower had double heads, which made it easier to shower more than one child at a time. On the weekends they have a nice breakfast, homemade waffles, muffins, bagels, juices and coffee. There is a computer for your use with no charge. There is also a hotel cat that just adds to the whole ambience. Although you can't get into the ocean from there, it is still a lovely setting. Very quiet and quaint. The hotel staff is very accommodating and friendly. Driving to the hotel, I was questioning where we were going, but once there, it was definitely a fine. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The good: I would stay here again. The highlight was a courtyard with a swimming pool, and lots of chairs/tables for watching the sunset. There was also a lower "deck" with more chairs and tables. For us it was perfect for bringing back breakfast or dinner, and eating it on the deck while watching the sun set, or while our 2-year old son ran around happily. The hotel also has a nice "lobby", where there's a computer terminal, handy for searching local sites or pre-printing your boarding pass. They serve a simple continental breakfast (with waffles) on weekends only. Each room has a fridge. Right next door is a little shop that sells smoothies and simple meals (breakfast, gyros, falafels, hot dogs, etc), which is perfect if you're eating on the run, or want to keep things simple. Newport Avenue is a 7 block walk (15 minutes) thru a residential neighborhood. Another couple blocks along Newport and you'll hit restaurants, and finally Ocean Beach (probably a good 30+ minutes from the hotel). That distance is technically "walking distance", but it was too far to make it conveniently with my pregnant wife and toddler. The bad: Our room was much smaller than I expected. It was a tight squeeze for 3, although we got used to it during our 4 night stay. If it wasn't for the courtyard, the room size would have been intolerable. The hotel had bigger suites, but that was out of our budget. The inside of the room felt very much worn. Old, stained carpets and walls, lumbering closet doors, etc. It might have been clean, but it sure didn't look clean since it was so old and worn. We spilled a smoothie on their old carpets, and they charged us $40 for staining one of their towels in an effort to clean it up. Also, there's no parking. You just find a spot on the street as close as possible. That wasn't typically a problem for us, but it's something to know in advance. The ugly: The hotel. Maybe I came in with the wrong expectation. I sort of expected "Holiday Inn Express" appearance and quality, but instead saw a pretty tired little motel. As I mentioned before, the courtyard made the stay worthwhile for us. The room itself left a lot to be desired, but for the price I suppose it wasn't totally unreasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent one week here on family vacation with two children (ages 4 and 6). The room was clean and quiet. Housekeeping was excellent. We had a one room suite with a fold out couch for the boys. The staff was friendly and seemed to really like kids. The other guests at the Inn were also friendly and nice. The Inn is located in a quiet and safe neighborhood. It was easy to get around to most points in San Diego (harbor, balboa park, point loma, seaworld, mission beach) without hitting the Interstate. The heated pool was a hit with the kids. One night we ordered chinese and a 20something San Diego native appeared at the door with the food. He politely asked if these were vacation homes or something. When I said yes, he replied that he had lived in San Diego all his life and didn't even know the Inn was there. He then looked at the ocean and remarked - it doesn't get any better than this. 'nuff said!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and Serene”
Reviews.Author: linda528
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three-day stay at the Inn, and really didn't want to leave. The well-documented views lived up to their reputation, and the Inn is in a nice, quieter, more residential spot than many other area hotels (yet still close to gaslamp, etc). The Inn provides very comfy louge chairs from which to contemplate the waves, and the feeling of peace and serenity that overcomes you is great. King Studio has a lovely view but is a bit small. Staff is nice but not so hot on restaurant recommendations and not great at giving directions--do your homework in advance.

HotelInfo.Name: The Inn at Sunset Cliffs
HotelInfo.Address: 1370 Sunset Cliffs Blvd, San Diego, CA 92107
